item.title: UK Money Managers Praise Labour’s Regulatory Pivot to Growth
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Asset management bosses have praised the Labour government’s efforts to boost economic growth and the competitiveness of the UK’s financial center. The UK has seen “two decades worth of malaise in action,” Matthew Beesley, chief executive officer of Jupiter Fund Management Plc, said a...

item.title: Vujcic Sees ECB-Cut Bets Reasonable With More Clarity in Spring
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Market expectations for three more European Central Bank interest-rate cuts this year are reasonable right now, even though it will take until the start of the second quarter to know with more certainty if they’ll materialize, according to Governing Council member Boris Vujcic. By the...

item.title: Deutsche Bank Raises Bar for SRT Leverage Amid ECB Inquiry
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Deutsche Bank AG is tightening terms under which it provides loans for investors such as hedge funds to buy significant risk transfers. The Frankfurt-based lender is letting investors in SRTs know that the bank will be less proactive in offering clients financing via repurchase agreem...

item.title: ECB Paper Suggests Two More Cuts Can Take Rates to Neutral
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Economists at the European Central Bank said the neutral rate of interest, a concept that may help determine where cuts in borrowing costs will end, is probably between 1.75% and 2.25%. That would mean the top of the range could be reached with two more quarter-point reductions in the...

item.title: ECB Could Face Biggest Personnel Shakeup Since 2019 This Year
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- The European Central Bank is set to enter a new phase of unpredictability as the terms of seven of its 26 interest rate-setters end by December, marking its biggest personnel shakeup since 2019. They include the panel’s longest-serving member, Klaas Knot of the Netherlands, along with...
